text: Brewton is a city in Escambia County, Alabama, United States. At the 2020 census the population was 5,276. The city is the county seat of Escambia County. ==Government== The city government consists of mayor who is elected at large and five member city council who are each elected from a district. ==Education== Schools in the Brewton City School System: *Brewton Elementary School, on Douglas Ave. *Brewton Middle School, on Liles Blvd. *T. R. Miller High School, on Douglas Ave. Brewton is home to Jefferson Davis Community College, a small postsecondary school that primarily gives associate's degrees. == Culture and special events == The annual Alabama Blueberry Festival is held at Burnt Corn Creek Park and downtown Brewton. The Thomas E. McMillan Museum is on the campus of the Jefferson Davis Community College. ==Notable natives or residents== * Wayne Frazier, pro football player, Auburn University, *Teddy Keaton, Football coach, Stillman College *Kevin Sumlin, Football coach, Texas A&M; Aggies football == References == Category:Cities in Alabama Category:County seats in Alabama Category:1885 establishments in the United States Category:1880s establishments in Alabama
title: Brewton, Alabama
